channel.title: Death penalty
channel.description:
[glow=red,2,300][size=12pt][b]Please vote even if your undecided : )[/b][/size][/glow]
in goverment we are doing debates every week and we are split into two teams my team has to go pro death penalty.. and at first i was like "great... :( this is going to be stupid...im totally against the death penalty..." but as i did reaserch on the subject i was like "hmmmmm.. interesting" and not im undecided. ill see tomorrow who wins the debate my side or the other :D[br][size=1]Posted at: February 23, 2006, 01:37:46 pm[/size][hr]major issuse ( humaneness, deterance, death penalty being irreversable)

There are physcopaths who don’t know the difference from right and wrong.

we should kill sane poeple who comt cirmes( like that part)
but we shouldn’t kill the crazy peeps ( kinda stupid) huh?

item.title: Death penalty
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The Un-Named:

Undecided. It’s sort of good but there’s resons why it’s banned in other countys. If someone did somthing really bad exceeding the death penalty I’d say tourture. The death penalty is the easy way out of a big crime in my opinion but tourture’s bad. If you get my drift.

Won’t even happen, because that is inhumane no matter which way you see it.

Other then that, there’s always the chance that an innocent person dies. Prison Break is obviously only fictional, but in reality, there have been same case scenarios.

Another point to note, how ‘humane’ is lethal injection? People thought that hanging was humane at one stage, until it was noticed that if the neck doesn’t break, they slowly choke to death.
The electric chair was thought to be humane, until people were slowly roasted to death if anything went wrong.
Gas chambers were thought to be humane too, but again there’s the possibility of a slow death.
So how humane is lethal injection? Is it really as nice as it looks? Prisoner closes their eyes, and the staff there call it a day? Or is there more going on, that the viewing people aren’t subjected to because of the second agent injected, which paralyses their muscles.
For all you know, they might have been writhing around in agony if it wasn’t for that second agent, which is a compound containing chlorine I believe.

EDIT: To everyone who says it’s not harsh, aren’t you scared of dieing? For all you know you’ll be floating around in an empty void for all eternity after death.

bobby:

I think anyone who commits a crime that can’t prove that they are crzy should promtly ( no 10 years of jail time) be shot. why pay for them in jail. they did the crime so they hsould die.

That is about as controversial as what a substitute teacher suggested at school last year.
This ‘teacher’ thought that it’d be a great idea to just give users of Ice and Heroin a quick injection to kill them (a morphine overdose or something). His argument was that the shot was maybe 40 cents, but the cost to send them to rehabilitation again and again (once you’ve tried Ice, you’re pretty much fucked) was far greater.
I said to him “How about we kill all of the old dinosaurs like yourself - 40 cent injections are a lot cheaper then paying for hospital funding for oldies”. Secondly, I told him that “Yeah, it’d be OK until it was your turn, or the turn of someone you cared for”.
Ignore that opinion on old people, it was just my example to him so he knew exactly where he stood.

Anyway, if it came to your turn in jail Bobby for whatever crime, you wouldn’t be jumping up and down saying “Kill me, kill me, I don’t want to waste the government’s money!!!”.

Read full topic

item.title: Death penalty
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Kamu, post:89, topic:293”][quote author=Secet link=topic=42.msg1008756#msg1008756 date=1173824220]

The death penalty makes no sense.

“Killing is wrong, so we are going to kill you”.

Good going, America.

This is exatcly my point, it doesn’t make sense to kill one more people when there has already been kills.

How do u know there isnt one lol…“caugh” maybe the bible has somthing to do with it lol =p

Bibble? Isn’t that the book, that humans wrote. Sorry, but if I believe in it I could believe in Lord of the Rings too.
[/quote]

What about imprisoning a person who kidnapped a little boy and imprisoned him for 10 years to use as a sex slave?

“Locking up people is bad therefore we lock you up.”

Good going, civilized world who uses prisons.

P.S. America isn’t the only place to have used/use the death penalty you idiot Mopman.[/quote]

I hate you.

item.title: Death penalty
item.dc:creator: @Kamu Kamu
item.description:
@Kamu wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:86, topic:293”][quote author=bobby link=topic=42.msg1011341#msg1011341 date=1173866741]
I think anyone who commits a crime that can’t prove that they are crzy should promtly ( no 10 years of jail time) be shot. why pay for them in jail. they did the crime so they hsould die.
[/quote]

There are two issues with this system. One is that America and indeed most western countries have a very strange view on what a crime actually is. We are imprisoning many innocent people, that is bad enough without killing innocent people. Also, one cannot always prove they are “crazy”. They probably don’t even know it themselves.[/quote]

These girls are really sleazy, all they say is “please me”.

Read full topic
